poem:
Title: Unmet Promises, Unheard Pleas

In Sedgefield, where cricket cries echo,
came Johnson, with promises hollow.
The faces, bent towards a hope,
a tsunami from the Wear to the Tees.
Now, silence as buzz turns to sorrow,
pet signs in vain, the Northern Echo.
A landscape void of levelling dreams,
like fruit left too long, it seams.
